H0.text: Mars and Earth are the planets closest to each other in the arrangement of planets studied by Mrs. Henry's class in the solar system.

H1.text: Saturn and Jupiter are the planets closest to each other in the solar system, as determined by Mrs. Henry's class during their study of planetary arrangements.

H2.text: Mercury and Venus are the planets closest to each other, as identified by Mrs. Henry's class studying the arrangement of planets in the solar system.

H3.text: Uranus and Neptune are the planets closest to each other in the solar system, as determined by Mrs. Henry's class when studying the arrangement of planets.

A4.text: Venus is approximately 0.33 AU farther out from the Sun than Mercury

A5.text: Saturn is 4.3 AU out from Jupiter
